titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that a commemorative postage stamp should be issued by the United States Postal Service honoring Arthur Ashe, and that the Citizens Stamp Advisory Committee should recommend to the Postmaster General that such a stamp be issued.

Expressing the sense of the Congress that a commemorative postage stamp should be issued by the United States Postal Service honoring Arthur Ashe, and that the Citizens Stamp Advisory Committee should recommend to the Postmaster General that such a stamp be issued.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.

bill.summary: Declares the sense of the Congress that: (1) a commemorative postage stamp should be issued by the United States Postal Service honoring Arthur Ashe; and (2) the Citizens Stamp Advisory Committee should recommend to the Postmaster General that such a stamp be issued.
